description: information about plants that are food

command.prompt:
Generate one row for a table of information about plants that are food. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Plant;Variety;Season;Color;Fruit;Soil;Water;Temperature;Light;Pruning;Fertilizer;Pest

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Plant;Variety
Apple;Granny Smith
Basil, Sweet;Summer
Broccoli;Spring
Cabbage;Fall
Pear;Bartlett
Cherry;Rainier
Raspberry;Bountiful
Peach;August Pride
Watermelon;Crimson Sweet
Grape;Concord
Strawberry;Temptation
Carrot;Nantes
Radish;Cherry Belle
Eggplant;Neon
Avocado;Hass
Cucumber;Lemon
Squash;Acorn
Asparagus;Jersey Knight
Tomato;Beefsteak
Lettuce;Romaine
Spinach;Space

Output the row in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.epilogue:
Bluecrop is a variety of blueberry that is known to produce fruit in the spring, summer, and fall seasons. The berries are blue in color. Blueberries prefer moist, acidic soil and require medium water intake. They thrive in temperatures between 60-70°F and full sun exposure. Blueberries require moderate pruning and acidic fertilizer. The main pest for blueberries are birds.

Sources:
1. "Bluecrop." Missouri Botanical Garden, www.missouribotanicalgarden.org/PlantFinder/PlantFinderDetails.aspx?kempercode=b630.
2. "Blueberry, Highbush." Alabama Cooperative Extension System, www.aces.edu/pubs/docs/A/ANR-1367/ANR-1367.pdf.
3. "How to Grow Blueberries." The Spruce, www.thespruce.com/how-to-grow-blueberries-2132423.
